snippet: The race, a 2.4-mile swim, a 112-mile bike ride and a 26.2-mile run, was deemed too expensive and complicated to host and too difficult for spectators to watch.
abstract: Ironman, the organizer of the world’s best-known triathlon, will shut its race in the New York area after just one year; say race was too expensive and complicated to host and too difficult for spectators to watch and the prospects for improving conditions were slim.
lead_paragraph: The race, a 2.4-mile swim, a 112-mile bike ride and a 26.2-mile run, was deemed too expensive and complicated to host and too difficult for spectators to watch.

headline.seo: Organizers Say Ironman Won’t Return to New York City Because of Financial and Logistical Issues
headline.main: Organizers Say Ironman Will Not Return to New York City
headline.print_headline: Organizers Say Ironman Will Not Return to New York City
